isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - PROGRAMMING

svcsubsecinfo.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module can be programmed in the field using the EZ-Tech or Pro-Link 9000 EST connected to the data link (electronic engines only) or by physically setting the DIP switches ( Figure 9).
Refer to the EZ-Tech instrument cluster software manual or the Pro-Link 9000 IPC cartridge manual for electronic programming instructions.

important.para: Moving any of the DIP switches from the 0 position disables the speedometer/tachometer programming. If a DIP switch is moved for re-programming or any other reason, then all of the switches must be physically moved to the positions indicated on the module label (or lineset ticket). If all of the switches are returned to zero, the original factory programmed settings will be enabled.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module has two sets of DIP switches with eight switches in each bank. The switches are located on the top of the module. When programmed at the factory, all of the switches are physically in the zero position.The zero position is with the switch positioned toward the front of the module, when viewing the top edge of the module. A label is placed on the module that provides the module part number and switch positions (electronically set to these positions although the switches are physically in the zero position).
